page.title: 02Transport
page.content: In the small village of Rowney Green, there are many little roads which are quite dense, very narrow and also winding, most of these roads are relatively busy with farming machinery. As well as being a fairly remote villae Rowney Green has a very poor system of public transport. There are only two bus services during the week, one of which is on a Tuesday and the other on Friday. It collects the villagers at the Old Post Office and takes them into Reditch to do shopping etc. and it returns three hours later. With this system as you can gather many villagers rely on their own transport. But many are happy with this. A new link to the M42 is opening in 1985/6 on the Northern edge of Rowney Green. There is much discussion as to whether this is a good idea or not.
